XData.Data: <cube xmlns="http://www.intersystems.com/deepsee" name="SensorData" displayName="Sensor Data" disabled="false" abstract="false" sourceClass="Net.MQTT.Storage" countMeasureName="%COUNT" bucketSize="8" bitmapChunkInMemory="false" precompute="0" disableListingGroups="false"> <dimension name="Devices" disabled="false" hasAll="false" allCaption="All DeviceID" allDisplayName="DeviceID" type="data" calendar="gregorian" iKnowType="entity" hidden="false" showHierarchies="default"> <hierarchy name="H1" disabled="false" hidden="false"> <level name="DeviceID" displayName="Device ID" disabled="false" sourceProperty="DeviceID" list="false" useDisplayValue="true" useAsFilter="true" hidden="false"> </level> </hierarchy> <additionalDescription>undefined</additionalDescription> </dimension> <dimension name="Sensors" disabled="false" hasAll="false" allCaption="All SensorType" allDisplayName="SensorType" type="data" calendar="gregorian" iKnowType="entity" hidden="false" showHierarchies="default"> <hierarchy name="H1" disabled="false" hidden="false"> <level name="SensorType" displayName="Sensor Type" disabled="false" sourceProperty="SensorType" list="false" useDisplayValue="true" useAsFilter="true" hidden="false"> </level> </hierarchy> <additionalDescription>undefined</additionalDescription> </dimension> <dimension name="SentAt" displayName="Sent At" disabled="false" hasAll="false" allCaption="All CreatedAt" allDisplayName="CreatedAt" sourceProperty="CreatedAt" type="data" calendar="gregorian" iKnowType="entity" hidden="false" showHierarchies="default"> <hierarchy name="H1" disabled="false" hidden="false"> <level name="SentAtDate" displayName="Sent at - Date" disabled="false" sourceExpression="$Extract(%source.CreatedAt, 1, 10)" list="false" useDisplayValue="true" useAsFilter="true" hidden="false"> </level> <level name="SentAtHour" displayName="Sent at - Hour" disabled="false" sourceExpression="$Extract(%source.CreatedAt, 1, 13)" timeFunction="HourNumber" list="false" useDisplayValue="true" useAsFilter="true" hidden="false"> <property name="SentAtHourP" displayName="Sent at - Hour" disabled="false" sourceExpression="$Extract(%source.CreatedAt, 12, 13)" hidden="false" isName="true" isDescription="false" isReference="false" useDisplayValue="false"> <additionalDescription>undefined</additionalDescription> </property> </level> <level name="SentAtMinute" displayName="Sent at - Minute" disabled="false" sourceExpression="$Extract(%source.CreatedAt, 1, 16)" timeFunction="MinuteNumber" list="false" useDisplayValue="true" useAsFilter="true" hidden="false"> <property name="SentAtMinuteP" displayName="Sent at - Minute" disabled="false" sourceExpression="$Extract(%source.CreatedAt, 12, 16)" hidden="false" isName="true" isDescription="false" isReference="false" useDisplayValue="false"> <additionalDescription>undefined</additionalDescription> </property> </level> <level name="SentAtSecond" displayName="Sent at - Second" disabled="false" sourceExpression="$Extract(%source.CreatedAt, 1, 19)" list="false" useDisplayValue="true" useAsFilter="true" hidden="false"> <property name="SentAtSecondP" displayName="Sent at - Second" disabled="false" sourceExpression="$Extract(%source.CreatedAt, 12, 19)" hidden="false" isName="true" isDescription="false" isReference="false" useDisplayValue="false"> <additionalDescription>undefined</additionalDescription> </property> </level> </hierarchy> <additionalDescription>undefined</additionalDescription> </dimension> <measure name="Value" displayName="Sensor Value" disabled="false" sourceProperty="Value1" aggregate="AVG" type="number" hidden="false" searchable="false"> </measure> </cube>

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Agent
Class.Description:
The MQTT Agent is always started by a Net.MQTT.Client in the background to manage the real communication with the broker.

The agent inherits its settings from the Client, which started it and it is responsible for:

  • Building the TCP connection to the broker.
  • Executing the tasks created by the Client (and the Agent itself) based on the Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList records. E.g.: sending various messages to the broker.
  • Keeping the connection alive by sending PING requests to the broker, when no other messages has been sent for a certain amount of time.
  • Listening for incoming messages from the broker and triggering appropriate actions based on the message type.

Property.name: fatalError
Property.Description:
If connection error is assumed, an automatic re-connect attempt is done by the Agent. In that period this property is set to -1.

If automatic re-connect is not possible, fatalError is set to 1, and the Agent stops itself.

Method.name: StartListening
Method.Description:
This method is called directly (as a background job) by the Net.MQTT.Client to start the Agent.

pInitialState is the XML serialized content of the calling Client object, from which the agent can populate its own properties.

pUsername and pPassword are the optional credentials to be sent to the broker on connecting.

The Agent builds the TCP connection to the broker, sends a CONNECT message and then starts to communicate with the broker.

Method.name: Listen
Method.Description:
The main function of the Agent. Unless a fatal error happens, it runs in an endless loop, doing onw of the followin things in every loop:
  • If a pending Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList object can be found for the Agent's unique connectionId, it starts to execute the corresponding task, then signals the initiator of the task via the %SYSTEM.Event API.
  • If no response has arrived from the broker for the last PING request within the KeepAliveInterval it treats the connection to the broker broken and stops.
  • If no other messages has been sent to the broker for a certain amount of time (~ 80% of the ) KeepAliveInterval, it sends a PING request to keep the connection alive.
  • Listens for incoming messages.

Method.name: RecvMessage
Method.Description:
Listens for incoming messages.

First takes a 1 byte MQTT Header. The takes the following 1 to 4 bytes to define the remaining length of the message. Finally reads the remaining part of the message and triggers appropriate action based on the message type (extracted from the Header).

Method.name: DoCONNECT
Method.Description: Builds the TCP connection to the MQTT broker and sends the CONNECT message.

Method.name: DoDISCONNECT
Method.Description: Sends a DISCONNECT message to the MQTT broker and closes the TCP connection.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..SendDISCONNECT() Do ..CloseDev() Use ..saveIODev
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoSUBSCRIBE
Method.Description:
Sends a SUBSCRIBE message to the MQTT broker.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList object is a Message Idenifier. If it contains a colon, this is a repeated attempt, because no acknowledge has been received from the broker within the defined timout period.

The details of the SUBSCRIBE message must be stored in a Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.Subscription object.
Method.Implementation:
Set dup = 0 Set msgid = pMessageId If $Length(pMessageId, ":") > 1 { Set msgid = $Piece(pMessageId, ":", 1) Set dup = (''$Piece(pMessageId, ":", 2)) } Set topics = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.Subscription).GetTopicList(..ClientId, msgid, .tSC) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ..SendSUBSCRIBE(msgid, topics, dup)
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoUNSUBSCRIBE
Method.Description:
Sends a UNSUBSCRIBE message to the MQTT broker.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList object is a Message Idenifier. If it contains a colon, this is a repeated attempt, because no acknowledge has been received from the broker within the defined timout period.

The details of the UNSUBSCRIBE message must be stored in a Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.Subscription object.
Method.Implementation:
Set dup = 0 Set msgid = pMessageId If $Length(pMessageId, ":") > 1 { Set msgid = $Piece(pMessageId, ":", 1) Set dup = (''$Piece(pMessageId, ":", 2)) } Set topics = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.Subscription).GetTopicList(..ClientId, msgid, .tSC) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ..SendUNSUBSCRIBE(msgid, topics, dup)
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoPUBLISH
Method.Description:
Sends a PUBLISH message to the MQTT broker.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList object is a Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStore object ID. If it contains a colon, this is a repeated attempt, because no acknowledge has been received from the broker within the defined timout period.

The details of the PUBLISH message are stored in the referenced Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStore object.

On QoS levels > 0 it also pushes the Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus to the next state (either waiting for a PUBACK or PUBREC message).

Method.name: DoPUBACK
Method.Description:
Sends a PUBACK message to the MQTT broker for an incoming, QoS Level 1 message.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList object is a Message Identifier.

This is the end of the message flow of the incoming message.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..SendPUBACK(pMessageId) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus).DoneMessageIn(..ClientId, pMessageId)
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoPUBREC
Method.Description:
Sends a PUBREC message to the MQTT broker for an incoming, QoS Level 2 message.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList object is a Message Identifier.

It also pushes the Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus to the next state (waiting for a PUBREL message).
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..SendPUBREC(pMessageId) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus).ReleaseMessageIn(..ClientId, pMessageId)
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoPUBREL
Method.Description:
Sends a PUBREL message to the MQTT broker for an outgoing, QoS Level 2 message.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList object is a Message Identifier. If it contains a colon, this is a repeated attempt, because no acknowledge has been received for the original PUBLISH message from the broker within the defined timout period.

It also pushes the Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus to the next state (waiting for a PUBCOMP message).
Method.Implementation:
Set dup = 0 Set msgid = pMessageId If $Length(pMessageId, ":") > 1 { Set msgid = $Piece(pMessageId, ":", 1) Set dup = (''$Piece(pMessageId, ":", 2)) } Set tSC = ..SendPUBREL(msgid, dup) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus).CompleteMessageOut(..ClientId, pMessageId)
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoPUBCOMP
Method.Description:
Sends a PUBCOMP message to the MQTT broker for an incoming, QoS Level 2 message.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList object is a Message Identifier.

This is the end of the message flow of the incoming message.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..SendPUBCOMP(pMessageId) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus).DoneMessageIn(..ClientId, pMessageId)
Quit tSC

Method.name: SendCONNECT
Method.Description: Creates the variable header and payload of a CONNECT message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.

Method.name: SendDISCONNECT
Method.Description: Creates a DISCONNECT message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation: Quit ..PackSendMsg("", $$$MQTTDISCONNECT)

Method.name: SendPINGREQ
Method.Description: Creates a PINGREQ message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg("", $$$MQTTPINGREQ) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) ..lastPing = $ZDateTime($ZTimeStamp, 3, 1)
Quit tSC

Method.name: SendSUBSCRIBE
Method.Description: Creates the variable header and payload of a SUBSCRIBE message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
#dim topic As Net.MQTT.Message
Set varhdr = $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessageId)
Set payload = "", key = "" While 1 { Set topic = pTopics.GetNext(.key) Quit:(key = "") Set payload = payload _ ..GetUTFString(topic.Topic) _ $Char($Case(topic.QoSLevel, 2: $$$MQTTSubQoS2, 1: $$$MQTTSubQoS1, : 0)) }
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr_payload, $$$MQTTSUBSCRIBE, pDup, 1) Quit tSC

Method.name: SendUNSUBSCRIBE
Method.Description: Creates the variable header and payload of an UNSUBSCRIBE message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
#dim topic As Net.MQTT.Message
Set varhdr = $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessageId)
Set payload = "", key = "" While 1 { Set topic = pTopics.GetNext(.key) Quit:(key = "") Set payload = payload _ ..GetUTFString(topic.Topic) }
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr_payload, $$$MQTTUNSUBSCRIBE, pDup, 1) Quit tSC

Method.name: SendPUBLISH
Method.Description: Creates the variable header and payload of a PUBLISH message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
Set varhdr = ..GetUTFString(pMessage.Topic) _ $Select(pMessage.QoSLevel > 0: $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessage.MessageId), 1: "")
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr_pMessage.Content, $$$MQTTPUBLISH, pDup, pMessage.QoSLevel, pMessage.Retain) Quit tSC

Method.name: SendPUBACK
Method.Description: Creates the variable header of a PUBACK message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
Set varhdr = $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessageId)
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr, $$$MQTTPUBACK) Quit tSC

Method.name: SendPUBREC
Method.Description: Creates the variable header of a PUBREC message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
Set varhdr = $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessageId)
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr, $$$MQTTPUBREC) Quit tSC

Method.name: SendPUBREL
Method.Description: Creates the variable header of a PUBREL message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
Set varhdr = $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessageId)
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr, $$$MQTTPUBREL, pDup, 1) Quit tSC

Method.name: SendPUBCOMP
Method.Description: Creates the variable header of a PUBCOMP message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
Set varhdr = $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessageId)
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr, $$$MQTTPUBCOMP) Quit tSC

Method.name: RecvCONNACK
Method.Description: Evaluates a CONNACK message, received from the MQTT Broker and signals the initiator (Net.MQTT.Client) via the %SYSTEM.Event API about the success or failure of the connection attempt.

Method.name: RecvPINGRESP
Method.Description: Evaluates a PINGRESP message, received from the MQTT Broker and clears the lastPing property, so the Agent can know that the broker is still responsive and the connection is successfully kept alive.

Method.name: RecvUNSUBACK
Method.Description: Evaluates an UNSUBACK message, received from the MQTT Broker and signals the Net.MQTT.Client waiting for this acknowledge of a previously sent UNSUBSCRIBE message.
Method.Implementation: ..RecvAcknowledge("UNSUBACK", pDup, pQoS, pRetain, pContent)

Method.name: RecvPUBACK
Method.Description:
Evaluates a PUBACK message, received from the MQTT Broker and signals the Net.MQTT.Client waiting for this acknowledge of a previously published QoS Level 1 message.

This is the end of the message flow of the outgoing message.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..RecvAcknowledge("PUBACK", pDup, pQoS, pRetain, pContent, .msgid) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus).DoneMessageOut(..ClientId, msgid)
Quit tSC

Method.name: RecvPUBREC
Method.Description:
Evaluates a PUBREC message, received from the MQTT Broker and signals the Net.MQTT.Client waiting for this acknowledge of a previously published QoS Level 2 message.

It also pushes the Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus to the next state (a PUBREL message has to be sent).
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..RecvAcknowledge("PUBREC", pDup, pQoS, pRetain, pContent, .msgid) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus).ReleaseMessageOut(..ClientId, msgid)
Quit tSC

Method.name: RecvPUBREL
Method.Description:
Evaluates a PUBREL message, received from the MQTT Broker.

It pushes the Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus to the next state (a PUBCOMP message has to be sent), and cretes a new task (Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList) to complete the next step of the QoS Level 2 message flow.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..RecvAcknowledge("PUBREL", pDup, pQoS, pRetain, pContent, .msgid) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus).CompleteMessageIn(..ClientId, msgid) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) taskid = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList).CreateNewTask(..connectionId, msgid, "PUBCOMP", .tSC)
Quit tSC

Method.name: RecvPUBCOMP
Method.Description:
Evaluates a PUBCOMP message, received from the MQTT Broker and signals the Net.MQTT.Client waiting for this acknowledge of a previously published QoS Level 2 message.

This is the end of the message flow of the outgoing message.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..RecvAcknowledge("PUBCOMP", pDup, pQoS, pRetain, pContent, .msgid) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus).DoneMessageOut(..ClientId, msgid)
Quit tSC

Method.name: RecvAcknowledge
Method.Description: Generic method for evaluating an acknowledge type message and signaling the appropriate process via the <class>%SYSTEM.Event</class> API waiting for this acknowledge.

Method.name: RecvSUBACK
Method.Description: Evaluates a SUBACK message, received from the MQTT Broker, stores the QoS levels granted by the broker on the various items of the subscription message (see: Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.Subscription) and signals the Net.MQTT.Client waiting for this acknowledge of the previously sent SUBSCRIBE message.

Method.name: RecvPUBLISH
Method.Description:
Evaluates a PUBLISH message, received from the MQTT Broker and sends the incoming message to the OnMessage callback method, which is responsible for optionally filtering, processing and storing of the message.

If the QoS Level > 0, it also pushes the Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus to the next state (either a PUBACK or PUBREC message has to be sent), and cretes a new task (Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList) to complete the next step of the message flow.

Method.name: ProcessMessage
Method.Description: Evaluates the <property>OnMessage</property> setting, calls the appropriate callback method and handles potential errors.

Method.name: CloseDev
PackSendMsg
Method.Implementation:
Set header = $Char(pMessageType + $Select(pDup: $$$MQTTDup, 1: 0) + $Select(pRetain: $$$MQTTRetain, 1: 0) + $Case(pQoS, 2: $$$MQTTQoS2, 1: $$$MQTTQoS1, : 0) )
Set lng = $Length(pMessage) While 1 { Set nxt = lng # 128 Set lng = lng \ 128 If lng > 0 { Set nxt = nxt + 128 } Set header = header _ $Char(nxt) Quit:(lng '> 0) }
Set msg = header_pMessage Write msg, ! Set ..lastMessage = $ZDateTime($ZTimeStamp, 3, 1) $$$MQTTTraceOUT($$$MQTTMsgType(pMessageType), msg, $$$MQTTTraceInfo)
Quit $$$OK

Method.name: GetMessageType
IsDuplicate
Method.Implementation: Set a = $Factor($Ascii(pHeader)) Set b = $Factor($$$MQTTDup) Quit $BitLogic(a & b) = b

Method.name: GetQoSLevel
Method.Implementation: Set a = $Factor($Ascii(pHeader)) Set q1 = $Factor($$$MQTTQoS1) Set q2 = $Factor($$$MQTTQoS2) Quit $Select($BitLogic(a & q2) = q2: 2, $BitLogic(a & q1) = q1: 1, 1: 0)

Method.name: IsRetain
Method.Implementation: Set a = $Factor($Ascii(pHeader)) Set b = $Factor($$$MQTTRetain) Quit $BitLogic(a & b) = b

Method.name: GetUTFString
Method.Implementation:
Set tString = $ZCVT(pString, "O", ..transTable) Set tLen = $L(tString)
Quit $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(tLen) _ tString

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageCounter
Class.Description:
Auxiliary class to provide unique Message Identifiers for in-flight messages of a specific client connection.

MQTT standard only specifies that Message Identifiers must be unique among the currently in-flight messages. This class helps to initialize a new message sequence for each Client (Net.MQTT.Client) / Agent (Net.MQTT.Agent) pairs, based on the ClientId. This also means that ClientId must be unique among parallel Client instances currently running in the same database.

Method.name: CreateCounter
Method.Description: Used internally, by <class>Net.MQTT.Client</class> instances to create a new Message Identifier sequence. for a <property>ClientId</property> (which must be unqique among the currently running Clients).

Method.name: NextMessageId
Method.Description:
Used internally, by Net.MQTT.Client instances.

Returns the next available Message Idenfier for a specific ClientId.

Currently MQTT Message Identifiers must fall between 1 and 65535. After 65535 the counter simply turns into 1 again, simply assuming that this cannot lead to a collision among current in-flight messages.

Method.name: DropCounter
Method.Description:
Used internally, by Net.MQTT.Client instances.

Deletes the corresponding counter, when a Client is about to stop (more specifically: when its Net.MQTT.Agent is stopped).
Method.Implementation: ..%DeleteId(pClientId, 4)

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus
Class.Description:
Auxiliary class used only internally to keep track of QoS level 1-2 message, while they're waiting for completion of the communication. This class is used only internally by the Net.MQTT.Client and Net.MQTT.Agent classes.

Messages are delete from this class, as soon as the corresponding message flow is completed.

Method.name: RegisterMessageIn
Method.Implementation: ..RegisterNew(pClientId, pMessageId, "I", $Case(pQoSLevel, 2: "PUBREC", : "PUBACK"))

Method.name: IsRegisteredMessageIn
Method.Implementation: ..ClientKeyExists(pClientId, "I", pMessageId)

Method.name: ReleaseMessageIn
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "I", pMessageId, "PUBREL")

Method.name: CompleteMessageIn
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "I", pMessageId, "PUBCOMP")

Method.name: DoneMessageIn
Method.Implementation: ..Done(pClientId, "I", pMessageId)

Method.name: RegisterMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..RegisterNew(pClientId, pMessageId, "O", "PUBLISH")

Method.name: AcknowledgeMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "O", pMessageId, "PUBACK")

Method.name: ReceiveMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "O", pMessageId, "PUBREC")

Method.name: ReleaseMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "O", pMessageId, "PUBREL")

Method.name: CompleteMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "O", pMessageId, "PUBCOMP")

Method.name: DoneMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..Done(pClientId, "O", pMessageId)

Method.name: RegisterNew
Update
Done

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Aux.Subscription
Class.Description:
Auxiliary class is used only internally by a Net.MQTT.Client and its Net.MQTT.Agent to keep track of SUBSCRIBE and UNSUBSCRIBE message contents.

These messages must have a unique Message Idenfier among current in-flight messages (per Client), therefore all instances are dropped as soon as the corresponding message flow is completed.

Method.name: CreateSubscription
Method.Implementation:
Set obj = ..%New() Set obj.ClientId = pClientId Set obj.MessageId = pMessageId Set pSC = obj.%Save()
Quit $Select($$$ISOK(pSC): obj, 1: "")

Method.name: DropSubscription
Method.Implementation: ..%DeleteId(pId)

Method.name: AddTopic
Method.Implementation:
Set obj = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.SubscriptionTopic).%New() Set obj.Topic = pTopic.Topic Set obj.QoSLevel = pTopic.QoSLevel Set tSC = ..Topics.Insert(obj) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ..%Save()
Quit tSC

Method.name: GetTopicCount
GetTopicList
AckTopic
RetrieveAck

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Aux.SubscriptionTopic
Class.Description:
Auxiliary class is used only internally by a Net.MQTT.Client and its Net.MQTT.Agent.

Provides the topic list, which the primary content of SUBSCRIBE and UNSUBSCRIBE messages.

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList
Class.Description: Auxiliary class is used only internally, which proides an event-drivn interface for a <class>Net.MQTT.Client</class> and its <class>Net.MQTT.Agent</class>.

Property.name: ConnectionId
Property.Description: <property>connectionId</property> property of the corresponding <class>Net.MQTT.Client</class> and <class>Net.MQTT.Agent</class> objects.

Property.name: ContextId
Property.Description: Task-dependent context identifier. The cretor and processor of the task must agree on the meaning of this string.

Property.name: Action
Property.Description: List of actions, which require an event-driven interface.

Property.name: Status
Property.Description:
Current status of the task:
  • 0 - Pending, waiting for being processed.
  • 1 - In progress, the Net.MQTT.Agent already picked up the task.
  • 2 - Done, and kept for debugging purposes.

Method.name: WaitAck
Method.Description:
Called when a particular message (identified by pMessageId) of a client connection is waiting for an event.

The %SYSTEM.Event API is used to implement this, for detailed explanation of the return value, see that class documentation!
Method.Implementation:
Set ret = "" Do $System.Event.Create("^MQTT.Message(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ pMessageId _ """,""" _ pStatus _ """)") Set ret = $System.Event.WaitMsg("^MQTT.Message(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ pMessageId _ """,""" _ pStatus _ """)", pTimeout)
Quit ret

Method.name: SignalAck
Method.Description:
Called to trigger an event of a particular message (identified by pMessageId) of a client connection.

The %SYSTEM.Event API is used to implement this, for detailed explanation of the return value, see that class documentation!
Method.Implementation: Do $System.Event.Create("^MQTT.Message(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ pMessageId _ """,""" _ pStatus _ """)") Quit $System.Event.Signal("^MQTT.Message(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ pMessageId _ """,""" _ pStatus _ """)", pContent)

Method.name: WaitTask
Method.Description:
Creates a task and waits until it will be completed.

The %SYSTEM.Event API is used to implement this, for detailed explanation of the return value, see that class documentation!
Method.Implementation:
Set ret = "" Set taskId = ..CreateNewTask(pConnectionId, pContextId, pAction, .pSC) If $$$ISOK(pSC) { Do $System.Event.Create("^MQTT.Task(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ taskId _ """)") Set ret = $System.Event.WaitMsg("^MQTT.Task(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _taskId _ """)", pTimeout) }
Quit ret

Method.name: SignalTask
Method.Description:
Signals the completion of a task.

pStatusCode

is the return status of the method, which processed the task.

pDebugMode

shows, whether the Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList object has to be kept for debugging purposes, or can be deleted.
Method.Implementation:
Do $System.Event.Signal("^MQTT.Task(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ pTaskId _ """)", $Select($$$ISOK(pStatusCode): "", 1: $System.Status.GetErrorText(pStatusCode))) Set tSC = ..CompleteTask(pTaskId, pDebugMode)
Quit tSC

Method.name: CreateNewTask
Method.Implementation: Set obj = ..%New() Set obj.ConnectionId = pConnectionId Set obj.ContextId = pContextId Set obj.Action = pAction Set pSC = obj.%Save() Quit $Select($$$ISOK(pSC): obj.%Id(), 1: "")

Method.name: AcquireNext
AcquireTask
CompleteTask

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageCounter
Class.Description:
Auxiliary class to provide unique Message Identifiers for in-flight messages of a specific client connection.

MQTT standard only specifies that Message Identifiers must be unique among the currently in-flight messages. This class helps to initialize a new message sequence for each Client (Net.MQTT.Client) / Agent (Net.MQTT.Agent) pairs, based on the ClientId. This also means that ClientId must be unique among parallel Client instances currently running in the same database.

Method.name: CreateCounter
Method.Description: Used internally, by <class>Net.MQTT.Client</class> instances to create a new Message Identifier sequence. for a <property>ClientId</property> (which must be unqique among the currently running Clients).

Method.name: NextMessageId
Method.Description:
Used internally, by Net.MQTT.Client instances.

Returns the next available Message Idenfier for a specific ClientId.

Currently MQTT Message Identifiers must fall between 1 and 65535. After 65535 the counter simply turns into 1 again, simply assuming that this cannot lead to a collision among current in-flight messages.

Method.name: DropCounter
Method.Description:
Used internally, by Net.MQTT.Client instances.

Deletes the corresponding counter, when a Client is about to stop (more specifically: when its Net.MQTT.Agent is stopped).
Method.Implementation: ..%DeleteId(pClientId, 4)

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus
Class.Description:
Auxiliary class used only internally to keep track of QoS level 1-2 message, while they're waiting for completion of the communication. This class is used only internally by the Net.MQTT.Client and Net.MQTT.Agent classes.

Messages are delete from this class, as soon as the corresponding message flow is completed.

Method.name: RegisterMessageIn
Method.Implementation: ..RegisterNew(pClientId, pMessageId, "I", $Case(pQoSLevel, 2: "PUBREC", : "PUBACK"))

Method.name: IsRegisteredMessageIn
Method.Implementation: ..ClientKeyExists(pClientId, "I", pMessageId)

Method.name: ReleaseMessageIn
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "I", pMessageId, "PUBREL")

Method.name: CompleteMessageIn
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "I", pMessageId, "PUBCOMP")

Method.name: DoneMessageIn
Method.Implementation: ..Done(pClientId, "I", pMessageId)

Method.name: RegisterMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..RegisterNew(pClientId, pMessageId, "O", "PUBLISH")

Method.name: AcknowledgeMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "O", pMessageId, "PUBACK")

Method.name: ReceiveMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "O", pMessageId, "PUBREC")

Method.name: ReleaseMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "O", pMessageId, "PUBREL")

Method.name: CompleteMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..Update(pClientId, "O", pMessageId, "PUBCOMP")

Method.name: DoneMessageOut
Method.Implementation: ..Done(pClientId, "O", pMessageId)

Method.name: RegisterNew
Update
Done

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.Subscription
Class.Description:
Auxiliary class is used only internally by a Net.MQTT.Client and its Net.MQTT.Agent to keep track of SUBSCRIBE and UNSUBSCRIBE message contents.

These messages must have a unique Message Idenfier among current in-flight messages (per Client), therefore all instances are dropped as soon as the corresponding message flow is completed.

Method.name: CreateSubscription
Method.Implementation:
Set obj = ..%New() Set obj.ClientId = pClientId Set obj.MessageId = pMessageId Set pSC = obj.%Save()
Quit $Select($$$ISOK(pSC): obj, 1: "")

Method.name: DropSubscription
Method.Implementation: ..%DeleteId(pId)

Method.name: AddTopic
Method.Implementation:
Set obj = ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.SubscriptionTopic).%New() Set obj.Topic = pTopic.Topic Set obj.QoSLevel = pTopic.QoSLevel Set tSC = ..Topics.Insert(obj) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ..%Save()
Quit tSC

Method.name: GetTopicCount
GetTopicList
AckTopic
RetrieveAck

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.SubscriptionTopic
Class.Description:
Auxiliary class is used only internally by a Net.MQTT.Client and its Net.MQTT.Agent.

Provides the topic list, which the primary content of SUBSCRIBE and UNSUBSCRIBE messages.

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList
Class.Description: Auxiliary class is used only internally, which proides an event-drivn interface for a <class>Net.MQTT.Client</class> and its <class>Net.MQTT.Agent</class>.

Property.name: ConnectionId
Property.Description: <property>connectionId</property> property of the corresponding <class>Net.MQTT.Client</class> and <class>Net.MQTT.Agent</class> objects.

Property.name: ContextId
Property.Description: Task-dependent context identifier. The cretor and processor of the task must agree on the meaning of this string.

Property.name: Action
Property.Description: List of actions, which require an event-driven interface.

Property.name: Status
Property.Description:
Current status of the task:
  • 0 - Pending, waiting for being processed.
  • 1 - In progress, the Net.MQTT.Agent already picked up the task.
  • 2 - Done, and kept for debugging purposes.

Method.name: WaitAck
Method.Description:
Called when a particular message (identified by pMessageId) of a client connection is waiting for an event.

The %SYSTEM.Event API is used to implement this, for detailed explanation of the return value, see that class documentation!
Method.Implementation:
Set ret = "" Do $System.Event.Create("^MQTT.Message(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ pMessageId _ """,""" _ pStatus _ """)") Set ret = $System.Event.WaitMsg("^MQTT.Message(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ pMessageId _ """,""" _ pStatus _ """)", pTimeout)
Quit ret

Method.name: SignalAck
Method.Description:
Called to trigger an event of a particular message (identified by pMessageId) of a client connection.

The %SYSTEM.Event API is used to implement this, for detailed explanation of the return value, see that class documentation!
Method.Implementation: Do $System.Event.Create("^MQTT.Message(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ pMessageId _ """,""" _ pStatus _ """)") Quit $System.Event.Signal("^MQTT.Message(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ pMessageId _ """,""" _ pStatus _ """)", pContent)

Method.name: WaitTask
Method.Description:
Creates a task and waits until it will be completed.

The %SYSTEM.Event API is used to implement this, for detailed explanation of the return value, see that class documentation!
Method.Implementation:
Set ret = "" Set taskId = ..CreateNewTask(pConnectionId, pContextId, pAction, .pSC) If $$$ISOK(pSC) { Do $System.Event.Create("^MQTT.Task(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ taskId _ """)") Set ret = $System.Event.WaitMsg("^MQTT.Task(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _taskId _ """)", pTimeout) }
Quit ret

Method.name: SignalTask
Method.Description:
Signals the completion of a task.

pStatusCode

is the return status of the method, which processed the task.

pDebugMode

shows, whether the Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList object has to be kept for debugging purposes, or can be deleted.
Method.Implementation:
Do $System.Event.Signal("^MQTT.Task(""" _ pConnectionId _ """,""" _ pTaskId _ """)", $Select($$$ISOK(pStatusCode): "", 1: $System.Status.GetErrorText(pStatusCode))) Set tSC = ..CompleteTask(pTaskId, pDebugMode)
Quit tSC

Method.name: CreateNewTask
Method.Implementation: Set obj = ..%New() Set obj.ConnectionId = pConnectionId Set obj.ContextId = pContextId Set obj.Action = pAction Set pSC = obj.%Save() Quit $Select($$$ISOK(pSC): obj.%Id(), 1: "")

Method.name: AcquireNext
AcquireTask
CompleteTask
MyMessageHandler

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Client
Class.Description:
The main class and public API for the Cach Object Script MQTT Client sample implementation (version: 0.9).

For more information regarding the MQTT protocol visit the MQTT Org. website, or examine the OASIS standard specification.

Fully functional to demonstrate all kind of MQTT Client activities, but not a fully-featured client.

There are a few known (and maybe some unknown) limitations:

  • It's not prepared for SSL / TLS communication.
  • TCP/IP based only, cannot be used with web-socket based MQTT Brokers.
  • Communication of the Net.MQTT.Client and background Net.MQTT.Agent instances is limited to the tasks to be done / completed. This could be enriched with for example status information of the Agent, which would make it easier to monitor the background job from the Client interface and check its health status in certain scenarios.
  • Incoming and outgoing messages are simply logged into the Net.MQTT.MessageStore class. No any checks for duplicate messages are done (when an incoming message is repeated by the Broker, due to a lost acknowledge).
  • For incoming QoS Level 2 messages no retry mechanism is implemented: if no PUBREL message would arrive for the PUBREC acknowledge, the Agent will simply wait for it endless and the message remains in the Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageStatus, registered with a waiting for PUBREL status.

Questions, bug reports, recommendations are highly welcome to my Inbox.

Property.name: Host
Property.Description: Host name of the MQTT Broker.

Property.name: Port
Property.Description: Port number of the MQTT Broker.

Property.name: SSLConfig
Property.Description: SSL/TLS Configuration to be used to build a secured TCP Connection to the MQTT Broker.

Property.name: ConnectTimeout
Property.Description: Timeout (in seconds) of building the TCP Connection to the MQTT Broker.

Property.name: ReadTimeout
Property.Description: Generic default timeout for all kinds of action when either an incoming TCP communication is expected, or the Client interface has to wait for the <class>Net.MQTT.Agent</class> to complete a task.

Property.name: KeepAliveInterval
Property.Description:
The MQTT Broker may close the connection to the Client, if no requests are received within this interval (in seconds).

It's the responsibility of the Net.MQTT.Agent to send a PING request at least in each intervals.

Property.name: ClientId
Property.Description:
Identifies the Client at the MQTT Broker.

This implementation is restricted multiple places to use unique Client IDs among the co-existing Net.MQTT.Client instances within the same database. This restriction is acceptable, as the MQTT Brokers may reject multiple TCP connections with the same Client ID.

Property.name: CleanSession
Property.Description:
Sent with the CONNECT message to the MQTT Broker.

For details see the MQTT standard specification.

Property.name: LastWill
Property.Description: This object contains details of the "Last will and testament" of this Client - the message to be sent to subscribed Clients from the MQTT Broker in case, when the Broker's connection to this Client would be closed / lost.

Property.name: Retry
Property.Description:
Some QoS Level 1 and 2 messages (PUBLISH, PUBREL, SUBSCRIBE, UNSUBSCIBE) might be re-sent by the Client if no appropriate acknowledge can be received from the MQTT Broker within the specified timout intervals.
This property controls the maximum number of repeated attempts.

Property.name: RetryInterval
Property.Description:
Some QoS Level 1 and 2 messages (PUBLISH, PUBREL, SUBSCRIBE, UNSUBSCIBE) might be re-sent by the Client if no appropriate acknowledge can be received from the MQTT Broker within the specified timout intervals.
This property controls the wait interval (in seconds) within each repeated attempts.

Property.name: OnMessage
Property.Description:
User-defined method, which is called whenever the Net.MQTT.Agent receives an incoming message.

The required format of the OnMessage property is: Classname:MethodName. A sample implementation is provided in the Net.MQTT.MessageHandler.

If this property is empty, doesn't contain a valid classname/method name or the message handler method throws a runtime error, that event is logged in the traceTarget (if it's set).

Property.name: traceTarget
Property.Description: For debugging purposes this property can be set to any global variable names (e.g.: ^MQTT.Trace), in which case detailed trace information is logged into the specified global about the actions taken and also the incoming and outgoing TCP communication.

Method.name: traceGet
Method.Implementation: ..traceTarget '= ""

Property.name: traceLevel
Property.Description:
The following settings are available to influence the content to be traced in the traceTarget:
  • 0 - no trace information
  • 1 - errors only
  • 2 - errors and warnings
  • 3 - beyond errors and warnings, information about the actions made by the MQTT Client and Agent
  • 4 - in this case even some originally temporary information is not deleted from auxiliary tables (e.g.: Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList

Property.name: debugMode
Property.Description: *** DEPRECATED ***: Use traceLevel instead. For debugging purposes this property can be set to 1, in which case some originally temporary information is not deleted from auxiliary tables (for example: Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.TaskList).

Property.name: connectionId
Property.Description:
This property is a unique identifier of the Net.MQTT.Client and the related Net.MQTT.Agent instance, and it is used in event-driven communication of the foreground Client and the background Agent processes.

This is meant to be set automatically by the Client, do not set it directly!

Property.name: agent
Property.Description: Do not manipulate this property, which should always contain the JOB id of the corresponding <class>Net.MQTT.Agent</class>.

Method.name: StartAgent
Method.Description:
This is the first method to be called, in order to communicate with an MQTT Broker.

Starts a Net.MQTT.Agent instance, which is responsible for building the TCP connection and managing the communication with the broker.

Method.name: StopAgent
Method.Description:
Stops the Agent by sending DISCONNECT message and closing the TCP connection to the MQTT Broker.

If this method completes successfully, the Net.MQTT.Client instance is re-usable and its StartAgent method can be called again.

Method.name: KillAgent
Method.Description:
Normally this meant to be used only internally by the StopAgent method.

In some rare cases, when the Agent cannot be stopped normally (by sending a DISCONNECT message), this can still be used to terminate the Agent's background job and perform important maintenance steps.

Method.name: Subscribe
Method.Description:
Sends a request to the MQTT Broker to subsribe this client for a list of topics and controls the message flow:
Sends the SUBSCRIBE message and if no SUBACK has been received in the timeout period, it can retry the SUBSCRIBE according to the Retry and RetryInterval settings, before giving up and returning with an error.
If the acknowledge is received, the GrantedQoS of each elements in the pTopics list should contain the QoS Level assured by the MQTT broker for the corresponding topic.

Usage example:

Set tpc = ##class(Net.MQTT.Message).%New() Set tpc.Topic = "$SYS/broker/load/bytes/#" Set tpc.QoSLevel = 2 Set topics = ##class(%ListOfObjects).%New() Do topics.Insert(tpc) Set client = ##class(Net.MQTT.Client).%New() Set client.Host = "test.mosquitto.org" Set client.ClientId = "My1stMQTTClient" Set client.traceTarget = "^MQTT.Trace" Set sc = client.StartAgent() If ('sc) { Do $System.OBJ.DisplayError(sc) } Set sc = client.Subscribe(.topics) If ('sc) { Do $System.OBJ.DisplayError(sc) } If (''sc) { Set t=topics.GetAt(1) Write "Topic:'"_t.Topic_"'; Expected QoS:"_t.QoSLevel_"; Granted QoS:"_t.GrantedQoS_";", ! } ; wait a few seconds to receive some messages from the broker Set sc = client.Unsubscribe(.topics) If ('sc) { Do $System.OBJ.DisplayError(sc) } Set sc = client.StopAgent() If ('sc) { Do $System.OBJ.DisplayError(sc) } ZWrite ^MQTT.Trace

Method.name: Unsubscribe
Method.Description:
Sends a request to the MQTT Broker to unsubsribe this client from a list of topics and controls the message flow:
Sends the UNSUBSCRIBE message and if no UNSUBACK has been received in the timeout period, it can retry the UNSUBSCRIBE according to the Retry and RetryInterval settings, before giving up and returning with an error.

For usage example see the Subscribe method.

Method.name: Publish
Method.Description:
Publishes a message to the MQTT Broker and (on QoS Level > 0) controls the message flow.

In case of QoS = 1

Sends the PUBLISH message and if no PUBACK has been received in the timeout period, it can retry the PUBLISH according to the Retry and RetryInterval settings, before giving up and returning with an error.

In case of QoS = 2

Sends the PUBLISH message and if no PUBREC has been received in the timeout period, it can retry the PUBLISH according to the Retry and RetryInterval settings, before giving up and returning with an error.
After the PUBREC message has been received, it sends the PUBREL message and if no PUBCOMP has been received in the timeout period, it can retry the PUBREL according to the Retry and RetryInterval settings, before giving up and returning with an error.

Usage example:

Set message = ##class(Net.MQTT.Message).%New() Set message.Topic = "/isctest/client/sent" Set message.Content = 1 Set message.QoSLevel = 2 Set client = ##class(Net.MQTT.Client).%New() Set client.Host = "test.mosquitto.org" Set client.ClientId = "My1stMQTTClient" Set client.traceTarget = "^MQTT.Trace" Set sc = client.StartAgent() If ('sc) { Do $System.OBJ.DisplayError(sc) } Set sc = client.Publish(message) If ('sc) { Do $System.OBJ.DisplayError(sc) } Set sc = client.StopAgent() If ('sc) { Do $System.OBJ.DisplayError(sc) } ZWrite ^MQTT.Trace

Method.name: PublishQoS2
Method.Description: Internal method, used by Publish to manage the second pahse of QoS Level 2 message flow (PUBREL message is sent and PUBCOMP is expected).

Method.name: GetProtocolName
Method.Implementation: ..GetUTFString("MQIsdp")

Method.name: GetProtocolVersion
Method.Implementation: $Char(3)

Method.name: GetUTFString
Method.Implementation: Quit ""

Method.name: ResetClient
Method.Description:
For maintenance purposes only! USE WITH CARE!

If one of the message flows would break with unexpected error, the Net.MQTT.Client may leave records behind in some auxiliary classes which can prevent the same ClientId to be used in a subsequent execution of a Net.MQTT.Client instance.

This auxiliary method is responsible for clearing those records when needed.

WARNING: if this is called while a Net.MQTT.Agent with the same Client ID is still active, this may cause errors in the Agent, too. And stopping the Agent in a clear way (with sending a DISCONNECT message) won't be possible any more. Use KillAgent in this case!
Method.Implementation: Do ##class(Net.MQTT.Auxiliary.MessageCounter).%DeleteId(pClientId) &sql(DELETE FROM Net_MQTT_Auxiliary.Subscription WHERE ClientId = :pClientId) &sql(DELETE FROM Net_MQTT_Auxiliary.MessageStatus WHERE ClientId = :pClientId)

Method.name: ActiveDelayGet
Method.Implementation: Quit ""

Method.name: ActiveDelaySet
Method.Implementation: Quit $$$OK

Method.name: PassiveDelayGet
Method.Implementation: Quit ""

Method.name: PassiveDelaySet
Method.Implementation: Quit $$$OK

Method.name: IterationCountGet
Method.Implementation: Quit ""

Method.name: IterationCountSet
Method.Implementation: Quit $$$OK

Method.name: Delay

Class.name: Net.MQTT.Message
Class.Description: This structure is used as the input / output parameter type of multiple <class>Net.MQTT.Client</clas> methods.

Property.name: ClientId
Property.Description: In certain sitatuations the ClientId of the <class>Net.MQTT.Client</class> and <class>Net.MQTT.Agent</class> objects is also recorded in the Message object. Usually this property remains empty though.

Property.name: MessageId
Property.Description: Message Identifier. Usually it doesn't have to be set, when used as an input parameter.

Property.name: QoSLevel
Property.Description:
Quality of service, expected / provided by the client.
  • 0 - no guaranteed message delivery.
  • 1 - at least once delivery (simple acknowledge).
  • 2 - exactly once delivery (two level acknowledges).

Property.name: GrantedQoS
Property.Description:
In case of subscriptions, this is the quality of service, provided by the server (may differ from the one expected by the client).
For details see QoSLevel

Property.name: Retain
Property.Description: In some message flows (publish, subscribe) may show, whether the server is expected to keep the message, even after the client disconnects.

Method.name: OnMessage
Method.Description:
Sample implementation of a message handler method, which is called by the <class>Net.MQTT.Agent</class> everytime, when it receives a new incoming message.
The name of this class and method have to be set in the <property>OnMessage</property> property of the <class>Net.MQTT.Client</class> object.
Method.Implementation:
Set msg = ##class(Net.MQTT.MessageStore).%New() Set msg.ClientId = pMessage.ClientId Set msg.Direction = "I" Set msg.MessageId = pMessage.MessageId Set msg.QoSLevel = pMessage.QoSLevel Set msg.Retain = pMessage.Retain Set msg.Topic = pMessage.Topic Set msg.Content = pMessage.Content
Quit msg.%Save()

Class.name: Net.MQTT.MessageStore
Class.Description:
Sample message store for messages published by or recieved by Net.MQTT.Client and Net.MQTT.Agent instances.

This could be implemented different ways. For example: this implementation does not care about duplicate messages.

In this sample MQTT Client implementation this class just stores all the incoming and outgoing messages unconditionally.

For more documentation of message properties see: Net.MQTT.Message.

Property.name: Direction
Property.Description: Direction of the message: I is for input (subscribe), O is for output (publish).

XData.name: UrlMap
XData.Data:
<Routes>
<Route Url="/test" Method="GET" Call="Test" Cors="true"/>
<Route Url="/json/connect/:ClientID" Method="GET" Call="REST.JSON:GetConnect" Cors="true"/> <Route Url="/json/disconnect/:ClientObjectID" Method="GET" Call="REST.JSON:GetDisconnect" Cors="true"/> <Route Url="/json/publish/:ClientObjectID" Method="POST" Call="REST.JSON:PostPublish" Cors="true"/> <Route Url="/json/subscribe/:ClientObjectID" Method="POST" Call="REST.JSON:PostSubscribe" Cors="true"/> <Route Url="/json/unsubscribe/:ClientObjectID" Method="POST" Call="REST.JSON:PostUnsubscribe" Cors="true"/> <Route Url="/json/messages" Method="GET" Call="REST.JSON:GetLastMessages" Cors="true"/> </Routes>

Method.name: Test
Method.Implementation: &html<!> quit $$$OK

Class.name: REST.Callback
Class.Description: This class contains all the callback methods

Method.name: GetConnect
GetDisconnect
PostSubscribe
PostUnsubscribe
PostPublish
GetLastMessages
